paragraphs.text: Please Australia, don't let abusive boxer Floyd Mayweather in.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: While
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the boxing world's attention is focused on whether a fight between Floyd Mayweather and Manny Pacquiao might finally happen
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Mayweather has announced that he will visit Australia at the end of the month
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: The world's best boxer and highest paid athlete won't be fighting of course, merely making promotional appearances in Sydney, Melbourne and Brisbane
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Even leaving aside the disturbing idea that real, living people might pay to see the petulant man known as "Money" do anything other than box, there' s an issue: his extensive history of domestic violence
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: As
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Phil Lutton points out
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Mayweather has been arrested or cited by police in seven assaults against five different women
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: Mayweather's history of domestic violence began in 2001, just a month after dedicating his fight against Diego "Chico" Corrales to "all the battered women in the world."
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: He allegedly closed a car door on his then-partner Melissa Brim before repeatedly punching her while she lay on the back seat
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Not six months later he punched Brim in the neck at a Las Vegas shopping centre
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: He pleaded guilty and received a suspended sentence
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: In 2003 Mayweather allegedly punched two friends of his then-partner (and the mother of several of his children) Josie Harris in a nightclub and shook a female security guard
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: He was issued a citation and found guilty of two counts of battery
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: though the verdict was vacated
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the charges were "dismissed per negotiations."
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The same year he allegedly pummelled Harris and dragged her from a car by her hair
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: though she later dropped the charges and testified that she had lied to police
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Mayweather bought Harries a $500,000, 25-carat diamond ring shortly afterwards
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: In 2011 he finally did jail time (90 days) for savagely beating Harris in front of their children
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: He might have done many more if he wasn't a multi- millionaire and a linchpin of the economy in his home state of Nevada
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Even boxing fans, who are usually loathe to judge fighters for their conduct outside the ring(few boxers are angels, after all), are unimpressed with Mayweather
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: And
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: though boxing is a bit of a cultural afterthought these days, comments Mayweather made in support of abuser Ray Rice before his most recent fight focused the attention of the mainstream media on his unsavoury past
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Nevertheless
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: he was unrepentant
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Though Mayweather's criminal past might not automatically disqualify him from receiving an Australian visa
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: he would have to sit a "character test" on arrival
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: If
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: you watch the video above
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I'm sure you'll agree that such a test could be a major stumbling block
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In a similar case, Australia granted Mike Tyson, who was jailed for rape in 1992, a visa in 2012
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: though New Zealand did not
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: So
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: should Australia bar Mayweather?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: What's to gain from him visiting?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: He's a disgusting, unrepentant assaulter of women
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: his"I do what I want-ism" is totally undesirable
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: America might be stuck with him
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: I don't see why we should welcome him and allow him to make money in our country
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Last year Australia cancelled the visa of pick up artist Julien Blanc, whose techniques included simulated choking of women in bars, after a social media campaign and protests at venues
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: There has been nothing simulated about Mayweather's repeated punching of the women in his life
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: so
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: I'd imagine he (and the venues that welcome him) can expect the same treatment
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: On a more selfish note, I simply can't face the prospect of sections of the Australian media writing seriously about Anthony Mundine fighting Mayweather
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Mundine has begun to retweet fans(they are out there) who want him to call Mayweather out
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The flow of indistinguishable-from-parody articles has already begun
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Please Floyd, concentrate on fighting Manny
paragraphs.label: other

paragraphs.text: We'll be fine without you
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: No, really
paragraphs.label: no-unit
